other_tests.findings: In the MEN1-associated pituitary adenoma, 59 genes were significantly up-regulated and 24 were down-regulated. The up-regulated genes included those involved in cell growth and maintenance, apoptosis, growth arrest, and tumorigenesis.
Validation of the microarray results confirmed that genes FOS, GNAS, GADD45A, and NTS were over-expressed in the MEN1-associated pituitary adenoma.

The MEN1 adenoma displayed predominantly granular, nuclear staining for cFos, while staining in the sporadic mammosomatotropinoma was negative. GsÎ± showed a positive cytoplasmic/membranous pattern in the MEN1-associated adenoma and was negative in the sporadic tumor.
Complete excision of the tumor was not possible due to extensive invasion of the left cavernous sinus.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postoperative period managed temporarily with somatostatin analog (octreotide) and cabergoline.

other_tests.findings: GH deficiency developed two years after radiotherapy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Further thyroid hormone replacement was initiated and is currently maintained.
